trustfund: TF028639-GET-PPA ECUADOR BIODIVERSITY PROTECTION,TF028700-GET-BIODIVERSITY PROTECTION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Biodiversity
            Protection Project will be to support the restructuring and
            strengthening of the institutional capacity and overall
            policy and legal framework for adequate management of the
            National System of Protected Areas (NSPA). Special emphasis
            will be made in ensuring financial sustainability of the
            NSPA throughout the establishment of an efficient fees and
            tariffs system. While most of the project activities will
            benefit the entire system, proposed investments will be made
            in the Galapagos National Park (GNP) and seven of the most
            biologically rich conservation units on continental Ecuador
            selected for their contribution to protection of globally
            important biodiversity (Machalilla, Podocarpus, Sangay,
            Yasuni National Parks,and Cotacachi-Cayapas, Cayambe-Coca
            and Antisana Ecological Reserves). Action are designed to
            complement on-going Government and nongovernmental
            organization (NGO) activities on the NSPA. The project will
            seek to develop further and strengthen an innovative model
            for strategic planning and management of biodiversity, as
            initiated in the Galapagos National Park. The project
            consists of the following four components: 1) Institutional
            strengthening; 2) review and restructuring of the legal and
            regulatory framework; 3) outreach activities inclusive of
            community participation and raising of public awareness; and
            4) investment activities which will provide financing for
            civil works and infrastructure.
